revised_title: The Total Solar Eclipse of August 9, 1896: Observations and Expedition to Kio Island
tldr: The author describes the preparations and observations made during the expedition to Kio Island for the total solar eclipse of August 9, 1896. Despite unfavorable weather, the observing party, consisting of Mr. Fowler, Dr. W. J. Lockyer, and the author, managed to secure some observations of temperature, colors of the landscape, and general phenomena of totality. The paper also discusses the classification of stars and their spectra.
